summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unspecified recipient, regarding the provision of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell. It details the delivery of a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery productions, including replacements for files she had been unable to review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case, to whom discovery materials (laptop, hard drive, CD) are being provided for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working for the Southern District of New York, coordinating the delivery of discovery materials to Maxwell.

connections.description: Prosecutor providing discovery materials to the defendant as part of the legal process.

events.title: Delivery of Discovery Materials to Maxwell
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney delivers a laptop, hard drive, and CD containing discovery productions to Ghislaine Maxwell for her review.

events.title: Prior Discovery Production Shipment
events.description: A hard drive containing a separate discovery production, including replacements for files Maxwell had been unable to review, was sent via FedEx.

keyFacts: Discovery materials, including a laptop, hard drive, and CD, were provided to Ghislaine Maxwell for her review on November 18, 2020.
The prosecution had previously sent a hard drive via FedEx containing replacement files for prior productions that Maxwell had been unable to access.
The correspondence is from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in that jurisdiction.
The email includes multiple attachments, likely cover memos and letters detailing the contents of the discovery productions.
